summary: FBI 302 report documenting an interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons guard regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The guard discusses general knowledge among staff about Epstein's high-profile status and his own assignment on the day of Epstein's death, but denies specific knowledge of procedural failures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose death is the subject of the investigation. The guard states 'everybody knew the deal' with him and that staff were told to keep an eye on him.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The guard interviewed was assigned to station 11 south and heard commotion on that day.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Guard
events.description: FBI, OIG, and AUSAs interviewed a Federal Bureau of Prisons guard regarding procedures and knowledge surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Guard's Last SHU Assignment
events.description: The interviewed guard last worked in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) prior to Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: A BOP guard stated that 'everybody knew the deal' with Jeffrey Epstein and that guards and supervisors were instructed to 'keep an eye on him'.
The guard was assigned to station 11 south on the day of Epstein's death and heard commotion.
The guard denied having any specific knowledge of guards not performing their rounds or counts.
The guard implied a failure of procedure, stating 'would not happen if I was there, I do my rounds'.
The guard had worked in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) as recently as August 5, 2019.
